title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Acast**  

Since 2014, Acast has been building the world’s most valuable podcast marketplace, creating the technology that connects podcast creators, advertisers, and listeners. Its marketplace spans more than 140,000 podcasts, 3,300 advertisers, and one billion quarterly listens. Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen—across any podcast app or listening platform.

**About the role**  

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer that has the ability to work full stack, with proven frontend development skills and experience to deliver products with delightful user experience in our marketplace area.


Within campaign collaboration and management, our mission is to enable advertisers, creators and Acast internal personnel to effectively buy, plan and collaborate on podcast advertising campaigns. Pre-recorded ads and collaborative partnerships are well established forms of podcast advertising, and as the industry expands on the trusted creator-audience dynamic, new podcast advertising distribution channels emerge. We provide tooling to support podcast advertising collaboration, delivery and management at scale for all types of formats in a delightful manner for both advertisers and creators.


You will work in an autonomous, purpose driven team and take an important role in shipping new features while continuously increasing efficiency, stability and scalability of the systems. Beyond strong technical execution, the role requires an ability to interpret business and problem formulations together with your team, drive clarity, and turn that shared understanding into effective technical solutions. You are also expected to ensure that Acast continues to follow cutting-edge frontend development practices, both in our codebase and in how we shape our processes. You will be working in a multi-disciplinary environment with agile principles.


We run our infrastructure and systems on AWS. The systems are written in Node.js and Typescript, which you are expected to work with. We support our own systems and infrastructure in production.

**What you´ll do**

* You have experience with Node.js & Typescript
* You have experience with React
* You have experience with AWS or similar
* You have experience building delightful end user facing applications
* You have a pragmatic mindset and can make trade-offs on what to optimise for and when to ship
* You are keen to mentor others in the technical aspects you are already an expert in and you value working in a diverse team with developers of all experience and backgrounds. You value other people’s input no matter their experience level.

**Where you will be**

* Most of our teams are hybrids with some members co-located in offices and some working remotely. With a remote first way of working we want you to feel productive regardless of work location!
* For this role we’re hiring within Sweden, and therefore applicants will need the right to work in Sweden.
* We want to avoid teams distributed over time-zones, so this team will operate within the CET time zone for collaboration. This setup allows us for more flexibility and work-life balance.

**Culture**

  

Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.


Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.


We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.


We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

title: Senior Software Engineer UniCore
description:
*MSAB is a global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. A core value is to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results. The sole focus of MSAB is on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defence Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.*

**Senior Software Engineer – UniCore Technology (UCT)**

  

At MSAB, we’re building the foundational technology that powers the future of mobile forensics and data extraction for law enforcement and intelligence agencies worldwide. Our UniCore Technology (UCT) team is at the very heart of this mission, and we’re looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to help shape what comes next.  

  

**What you’ll be doing**

  

  

* Designing and implementing core components that will be used for years to come

- Working across the entire stack – from low-level system code to modern web frontends - Collaborating closely with a small, high-trust team of talented engineers  

* Influencing architecture, tooling, and engineering culture

  

**We’d love to meet you if you**  

* Treat programming languages as tools, not tribes – our stack is primarily C/C++/C# with TypeScript for web
* Have strong opinions about what “good code” looks like: simple, readable, performant, and maintainable
* Enjoy solving hard, real-world problems that actually matter

  

**Bonus points if you bring experience with**  

* CI/CD pipelines and modern DevOps practices
* Distributed systems (concurrency, fault tolerance, resilience)
* Cryptology and cryptographic protocols
* Protocol Buffers and gRPC
* Deep Windows and/or Linux systems knowledge

  

**Who you are**  

* Senior-level expertise in C/C++ and/or C# (we care more about depth than years)
* Self-driven, pragmatic, and low-ego
* Excited by the idea of owning significant parts of a critical codebase
* Eligible to work in Sweden

  

**Why MSAB**  

* Work on technology that has real impact in investigations and public safety
* Small engineering teams = big individual influence
* Solid benefits, and a healthy work-life balance
* Modern office in central Stockholm

  

You need to have a Swedish or EU Work permit.
There is much more to say about our growth plans, strategy, company culture, our values and how we create a safer world. But we save that to the interview.  

  

Welcome to apply now!  

  

For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com

  

### **What we can offer**


Create a safer world with us!


As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.


Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You will be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you will deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.


We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.


Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.

### **Are you up for the challenge?**

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
**Do you want to start your career in a place where cutting-edge physics meets real engineering impact? At Excillum you will work with the world’s brightest X-ray sources, used in areas such as semiconductor & electronics manufacturing, battery production & quality control, material science, chemistry & life science research. We are now entering an exciting phase where our products are being adopted more widely in industry, which brings new demands on performance, reliability and scale. If you’re curious, eager to learn and want to grow in a team full of friendly experts, keep on reading!**

**In this role** you will be part of our Software Design team, working broadly with both new development and improvements of existing products. You will get hands on experience with user interfaces, algorithms and hardware control, and you will work on software built around the physical principles that make our X ray technology possible. We mainly use C++ and Python in a Linux environment, and you will work closely with colleagues to achieve a precise X ray spot. The team handles the entire development lifecycle, from testing and implementation to deployment, collaborating closely with researchers, application specialists and hardware teams. You will also help shape our software infrastructure, contribute to CI/CD, develop GUI and HMI features and participate in hardware integration.


**A few words from your future manager**


*“**Hello! My name is Gustav and I’m the Head of Software Design at Excillum. I started my journey with Excillum 9 years ago as a software engineer and have learnt a lot by working with the incredibly skilled team here. I enjoy my time at Excillum because of the team, the technical challenges, and the possibilities ahead. My belief is that knowledge sharing, teamwork, technical challenges, and personal development are important and should be cherished to be able to create a comfortable and engaging working environment. Since I’m on parental leave at the moment, Klara is taking the lead in the team and driving our work forward*.*”*  



**To succeed in this role**


We believe you are a positive, curious and communicative team player who enjoys learning new things and facing challenges together with others.
  

  

You also have:


* A M.Sc. in software engineering, physics, electronics, mechatronics or similar
* Good knowledge of C++ and feel comfortable working in Linux
* Professional English skills
* *It is a plus* if you have experience with Python, Docker or Yocto, as well as an interest in physics and familiarity with complex systems

**Why** **Excillum?**

Excillum is a place for engineers who enjoy working close to real products and advanced technology. With under 90 employees you get the collaboration and visibility of a small organisation while working with technology used across the world. As we grow you will have opportunities to influence how we build, test and deliver our products and to develop your expertise across several areas.


We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and believe that diversity helps us build better ideas, better teams and better products. If this sounds like a place where you would enjoy taking your next step, we would love to hear from you. For questions, please reach out to our recruiter Caroline Kylbergh at caroline.kylbergh@excillum.com.


We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Do you want to work with one of the world’s most advanced X-ray sources? At Excillum you will join a company built on patented technology that has reshaped what the industry believes is possible. Our X-ray sources are used by global customers within semiconductor & electronics manufacturing, battery production & quality control, material science, chemistry & life science research.**

**We are now entering an exciting phase where our products are being adopted more widely in industry, which brings new demands on performance, reliability and scale. As part of this journey we are looking for software engineers to join our team. Here you step into an environment where complex systems, problem solving and high technical ambition come together.**

  

**As a software engineer at** **Excillum** you will work in a broad role and contribute to both new development and improvements of existing products. Most development is done in C++ and Python in a Linux environment, and your work will connect closely to advanced physics. You and the team work toward achieving a precise X-ray spot and build solutions that are reliable, high performing and easy to integrate for our customers.

**Your core tasks:**

* Develop and implement algorithms to enhance X-ray performance
* Work with control logic, hardware integration and error handling
* Build and improve UI components (GUI/HMI)
* Test and debug your own software on real hardware
* Work cross functionally with researchers, application specialists and hardware team
* Contribute to design discussions and help shape technical solutions

**To succeed in this role**


You enjoy working through challenges with others and aren’t afraid to explore new approaches when the answer isn’t obvious. You communicate openly, stay positive and create order in fast moving situations. You take pride in creating solutions that are stable, thoughtful and reliable.


You also have:


* A M.Sc. in software engineering, physics, electronics, mechatronics or similar
* A few years of professional experience with C++
* Experience working in Linux
* Professional English skills
* *It is a plus* if you have experience with Python, Docker, Yocto or physics simulations, as well as an interest in physics and familiarity with complex systems

**Wh****y Excillum?**

Excillum is a place for engineers who enjoy working close to real products and advanced technology. With under 90 employees you get the collaboration and visibility of a small organisation while working with technology used across the world. As we grow you will have opportunities to influence how we build, test and deliver our products and to develop your expertise across several areas.


We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and believe that diversity helps us build better ideas, better teams and better products. If this sounds like a place where you would enjoy taking your next step, we would love to hear from you. For questions, please reach out to our recruiter Caroline Kylbergh at caroline.kylbergh@excillum.com.


We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Senior Embedded Software Architect på det medarbetarägda konsultbolaget!
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu **Embedded Software Architect** som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt. Vi bygger med ambitionen att ta ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.


Som **Embedded Software Architect** kommer du leda och skapa tekniska lösningar för embedded system, inklusive design av hård- och mjukvaruarkitektur som uppfyller både prestandakrav och systemkrav. Vidare kommer du även utvärdera och rekommendera verktyg och teknologier som Yocto, Linux, RTOS, och C/C++ för att säkerställa att de bästa lösningarna används för projektet. Som konsult kommer du dessutom arbeta nära kunder för att förstå deras specifika behov, ge teknisk rådgivning och skräddarsydda lösningar, samt anpassa projekt och resurser för att uppfylla deras krav och förväntningar.

  

I den här rollen kommer du tillhöra enheten Things som är TechSeeds nystartade hårdvaruenhet med fokus på allting hårdvarunära, exempelvis Mekanik- och Elektronikdesign, konstruktion samt Embedded-mjukvara. Uppdragen kan även inkludera exempelvis testning samt automatiserad kod- och testgenerering, Automotive, Cybersäkerhet och även beröra elektronik, mekanik och DSP. Enheten är en central del i TechSeeds vision av att ta ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.

  


**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig vars expertis är embeddedutveckling! Som konsult kommer vi anpassa uppdragen utifrån dina intressen och din kompetens, med grunden stabilt i Embedded-världen. För att trivas i rollen behöver du ha minst fem års erfarenhet av embeddedutveckling och ha erfarenhet i rollen som arkitekt. Du har god erfarenhet av exempelvis bare metal, embedded Linux/Yocto, RTOS, C och C++ men har även ett stort intresse för att lära dig nya tekniker och miljöer. Du trivs i en konsultmässig roll där flexibilitet, kundfokus och förmåga att ta egna initiativ är avgörande för framgång. Vi ser gärna att du är en problemlösare som har ett proaktivt tillvägagångssätt och har vana av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.

  

Uppdrag kan variera men vi söker dig som vill designa, bygga, testa och leverera mjuk- och hårdvara till inbyggda system. Vi söker dig som intresseras av dessa områden och är van att arbeta nära kund genom hela utvecklingsprocessen, från beställning till leverans och uppföljning. Du arbetar metodiskt och strukturerat samt tar för självklart att dokumentera och testa löpande och noggrant.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Hello Senior Software Engineer! Thanks for taking the time to read this far. We're not sure how you found this job post. Perhaps someone told you about Humblebee. Perhaps you saw one of our articles online and thought this looked like a pleasant place to spend your days. However you found us, I’m happy you did. Humblebee is a digital service studio based in Sweden, and we’re looking to add key people like you to our fantastic team.

**What you’ll be doing**


As a Senior Software Engineer at Humblebee, you will be working in a multidisciplinary product team together with other developers and designers to create the best possible digital products and services for our clients. In our way of working, we build multidisciplinary product teams that work closely with our clients.


Our purpose at Humblebee is to build what’s needed, meaning that our software should reflect the client’s business, not be just a technical-jargon construct.


You will leverage JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Node.js, and GraphQL to build secure, high-performing software and also integrate AI and machine learning to enhance functionality.

**Is this you?**


Are you constantly experimenting with modern technologies to find new and improved ways of building things? Do you spread energy and inspire your team members?


We're looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our team in Gothenburg. It doesn’t matter that much if you call yourself front-end, back-end or full stack. The most important thing is that you’re good at programming and web development in general, and that you love developing great experiences and building what’s needed.

  

We’re looking for someone focused on the JavaScript/TypeScript stack, with experience in Node.js, React, .NET, C# and Headless CMS. We’d love to see experience with cloud technologies, including Serverless architecture, Kubernetes. Bonus points if you’re curious about infrastructure as code tools like Pulumi and have a keen interest within Artificial Intelligence. Candidates showing practical experience in these technologies will be prioritized. If you have experience with Microsoft Fabric, that's a definite plus.


At Humblebee we believe in the power of teamwork, and we expect our people to contribute to improving our ways of working. We don’t make a title distinction between frontend and backend developers at Humblebee, since we believe that web development is more complex than that. Instead, we encourage people to develop a T-shaped profile based on their skills and interests. Of course, we don’t expect all developers to know everything but rather feel a responsibility for the whole.

 **You are as important as your skills**


We employ people as much for their human traits as their competence and skill sets. We like good humans around us. We work in a collaborative environment (design sprints, development sprints, workshops with clients etc.) and therefore we employ people who are empathetic, kind, patient and gracious. We are Humblebee.

 **Before you apply, read this carefully**  

To help us find the right fit, we prioritize candidates according to these key criteria:

* **Technical Proficiency.** Strong experience with JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Node.js, and GraphQL. Familiarity with cloud technology like serverless architecture or Kubernetes is a plus.
* **AI Understanding.** Interest in integrating AI and machine learning components to enhance product functionality.
* **Quality Focus.** Commitment to building secure, high-performing, and reliable software that aligns with client business goals.
* **Team Collaboration.** Enthusiasm for working in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to a collaborative, T-shaped team dynamic.
* **Growth Mindset.** Openness to continuous learning, sharing knowledge, and improving ways of working.
* **Human-Centric Approach.** Empathy, kindness, and a proactive attitude are as important as technical skills.

  

Candidates who provide concrete examples of projects, contributions, or solutions demonstrating their expertise within these areas will be prioritized.


**Good to know!**


This position is full-time and based in our Gothenburg office with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). For this position a Swedish work permit is required. We do not offer relocation assistance or Visa sponsorship.


Humblebee is a multi-lingual company so please write your application in English.

title: Senior IT Business Analyst
description:
**Essential requirements:**

* Extensive Business Analyst experience (15+ years) in IT, ideally Agile, with strong capability in writing clear, structured requirements.
* Strong technical background, including technical education and past hands-on experience as a developer or tester.
* Ability to lead planning, coordination, and refinement activities, driving requirement processes end to end.
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills, working across multiple teams (business, product, architecture, development, QA).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving ability, with a structured approach and excellent attention to detail.

  

**Meritorious:**  

* Experience as a project manager
* Experience in payments or large-scale/complex system environments, as the role is within future payment solutions and cross-functional setups.

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 07-01-2026-31-12-2026  

**Last day to apply**: 09-12-2025  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: IT-chef till KåKå
description:
*Tycker du om att arbeta med IT-miljöer och sätta strategier för IT-arbete? Drivs du av att utveckla digitala lösningar för logistiska flöden?* *Vill du arbeta på Sveriges ledande leverantör av bageriingredienser och tillbehör till bagerier, konditorier och bageriindustrier? Vill du arbeta på ett växande bolag där vi tror på människans vilja och förmåga att skapa goda resultat och där vi värderar gemenskap, entreprenörskap, innovation och hjälper varandra? Känner du att värdeorden modig, inspirerande och pålitlig stämmer in på dig och vill vara med på vår resa? Då ska du söka denna tjänst redan idag!*

**Om företaget**


Välkommen till KåKå Group. I nästan 100 år har KåKå hjälpt bagare och konditorer att lyckas genom att utveckla, leverera och paketera produkter, tjänster och kundunika mervärden. Sedan 1999 ingår KåKå i Orkla-koncernen och har därmed tillgång till Skandinaviens mest omfattande produktion av ingredienser till bagerier och konditorier, till exempel genom Odense Marcipan och Frödinge Mejeri. KåKå, Jästbolaget, Werners Gourmetservice och Tredo bildar KåKå Group. Våra värdeord är modig, inspirerande och pålitlig vilket genomsyrar allt vi gör. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Lomma men vi har även kontor i Staffanstorp, Örebro, Göteborg, Stockholm och Skara. KåKå Group har en stark entreprenöriell kultur som präglas av framåtanda, utveckling och tillsammans hjälper vi våra kunder att lyckas!

**Om tjänsten**


Vi söker en IT-chef till vårt team som vill vara med på vår resa där vi satsar på att vidareutveckla det digitala stödet till verksamheterna. Rollen som IT-chef innebär både strategiskt och operativt arbete för att driva verksamheterna framåt. Tjänsten innebär följande:

* Budgetansvar för IT i samråd med CDO
* Personalansvar för gruppens IT-koordinator
* Sätta strategier för IT i samarbete med CDO och ledningsgrupper
* Utveckla och förvalta den strategiska IT-planen i linje med verksamheternas behov och övergripande mål
* Leda arbetet med infrastrukturen tillsammans med specialister och säkerställa en god systemförvaltning
* Installation, underhåll, avtal och uppsättning av hårdvara och nätverk
* Driva IT- och informationssäkerhetsfrågor
* 

**Vem trivs här?**


För att trivas och lyckas i rollen som IT-chef har du dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda och genomföra förändringsprojekt, gärna från organisationer med komplexa flöden inom lager, logistik och produktion. Du har god förståelse för hur IT-lösningar kan stödja och utveckla affärsprocesser. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med integrationer, print och infrastruktur. En hög kompetensnivå för Azure är viktigt i denna roll. Du har ett inre driv, kan leda dig själv och är prestigelös. Du får gärna vara en entreprenör som har förmåga att entusiasmera och engagera andra människor. Du kan navigera mellan högt och lågt, kort och lång sikt och har en god förmåga att föra en konstruktiv dialog med stakeholders internt och externt. Du arbetar strukturerat och självständigt, men är samtidigt en lagspelare och kommunikativ. Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Vi är en värdegrundstyrd organisation där vi förutsätter att du delar våra värdeord modig, pålitlig och inspirerande.  

  



**Vad erbjuder vi?**

  

Vi erbjuder dig ett omväxlande och stimulerande arbete i en spännande och framgångsrik bolagsgrupp inom Orkla-koncernen med högkvalitativa produkter, ett gott kamratgäng och en varm företagskultur. Tjänsten utgår från huvudkontoret i Lomma och kräver regelbunden närvaro på alla KåKå Groups kontor och lager. Vi erbjuder dig såväl personlig som professionell utveckling både i KåKå Group och via Orkla Food Ingredients.

 **Övrigt**


Vi arbetar med löpande urval så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Tillträde så snart som möjligt. För ytterligare information hänvisar vi till KåKå hemsida, www.kaka.se. Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta chef Jennie Körner på mail: jennie.korner@kaka.se alternativt HR-generalist Jonna Persson på jonna.persson@kaka.se. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-mail. Sista ansökningsdagen är den 16 januari 2026.

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: IT Tekniker med intresse för programmering!
description:
Vi söker nu en IT Tekniker till vår kund som vill arbeta i en bred och varierad roll med fokus på både support, drift och utveckling av moderna IT-lösningar. Hos kunden blir du en viktig del av IT-organisationen och bidrar till att säkerställa stabila och effektiva IT-leveranser till verksamheten.
   

  

 Rollen passar dig som trivs i gränslandet mellan infrastruktur och utveckling och vi ser gärna att du har ett intresse för programmering och kan skriva enklare kod, till exempel för att automatisera eller effektivisera processer.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med både on-prem och Azure-infrastruktur. Du stöttar driftorganisationen i det dagliga arbetet och är en nyckelperson när det gäller att hålla IT-miljön säker, tillgänglig och uppdaterad.
   

  

**Du kommer även att:**
* Administrera M365, Active Directory och Entra ID
* Arbeta i ITSM-system med ärendehantering
* Serva och stötta kollegor i alla IT-relaterade frågor
* Stötta vid walk-ins från användare som behöver hjälp på plats
* Beställa och administrera hårdvara och mjukvara
* Ansvara för onboarding och offboarding av användare
* Underhålla och felsöka nätverk och konferensutrustning
* Arbeta med både Mac och Windows-miljöer


**För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från en liknande IT-support- eller teknikerroll
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft 365, Active Directory och Entra ID
* Erfarenhet av Azure och on-prem infrastruktur
* Klienthantering (Windows och Mac)
* Nätverk och konferensutrustning
* ITSM-system och ärendehantering


**Som person** 
 är du en serviceinriktad och problemlösande person som trivs i en miljö med högt tempo och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Erfarenhet av automatisering, skriptning eller enklare programmering – exempelvis i PowerShell eller Python
   

  

**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  

**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
   

  

 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   

  

*Hoppas att du vill vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt!*

title: Är du IT-konsult och vill växa in i roller som CIO eller CTO?
description:
Vi söker dig som vill vara en del av expansionen av Buildable AB och dess ägare Qflow Group. Alla fördelar av att arbeta på ett litet bolag, med nätverksfördelarna av att jobba på ett storbolag!
   

  

 Buildable erbjuder produkter och tjänster inom digitalisering och IT-support för ett effektivt och hållbart samhällsbyggande. Vi erbjuder innovativa ledningssystem, projektytor och konsulttjänster inom IT, VDC, digitalisering, BIM etc.
   

  

**Om tjänsten - Vad du ska göra**
 Tillsammans med vår ägare Qflow Group söker vi en IT-konsult som vill växa in i rollen som en potentiell CIO eller CTO för koncernen Qflow Group. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer delas 50/50 mellan att strategiskt utveckla Buildables affär inom IT-konsulting och stötta Qflow Group strategiskt med att utreda koncernens behov av IT-stöd, policys, licenshantering mm för att på sikt kunna förbereda koncernen för en börsintroduktion.
   

  

 Buildable stöttar idag koncernbolaget samt några av dess dotterbolag med IT-partnerskap och support. Detta ska fortsättningsvis gälla och vi ser framöver att detta uppdrag kan utökas både inom koncernen, men även jämtemot andra kunder. Din uppgift kommer således vara:
   

  

* Bygga upp och stärka Buildable till att bli ledande aktör inom IT-Partnerskap ”IT för byggare, av byggare”
* Agera konsult åt externa kunder där erbjudandet delvis är din egen kunskap och expertområde
* Utveckla IT-strategi som stödjer Qflows övergripande affärsmål
* Utreda och förbereda koncernen för börsintroduktion
* Ta fram strategier och policys
* Utreda gränsdragningen mellan gruppens olika bolag och koncernen
* Identifiera befintliga och nya teknologier som kan skapa konkurrensfördelar
* Riskhantering och compliance – följa lagar, regler och säkerhetsstandarder
* IT-governance – säkerställa att IT-investeringar är i linje med verksamhetens behov
* Beskriva resursbehov för Qflow Group där ev. resursförstärkning och anställningsbehov i första hand kommer hamna hos Buildable
* Leverantörshantering – förhandla med externa IT-partners och tjänsteleverantörer


**Om dig - Vem vi tror att du är**
* Du har erfarenhet från byggbranschen och arbetar idag som konsult inom IT eller lång erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT inom ett större konsultbolag
* Du kan ha haft rollen som IT-chef, inköpare av IT-tjänster eller liknande
* Du är strategiskt lagd och har förmågan att navigera bland företagsledare och IT-experter för att hitta rätt väg framåt
* Du ser dig själv som en potentiell CIO eller CTO och som gärna vill växa in i rollen på sikt
* Nätverkande och social? Absolut – du är en person som ser möjligheter i varje projekt och har viljan och drivet att skapa merförsäljning
* Kommunikation är nyckeln – särskilt eftersom vi jobbar mestadels remote


**Vad du får (förutom ett grymt gäng kollegor):**
* Frihet under ansvar – jobba där du vill, men det vore ännu roligare om du har möjlighet att arbeta på något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Malmö, Göteborg eller Helsingborg, där vi sitter tillsammans med andra Qflow-bolag
* Digitala fikapauser och walk n’ talks – vi jobbar remote, men vi håller teamkänslan vid liv!
* Maxat friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr
* Bra pensionsavsättning och försäkringar – vi tänker på framtiden, och vi vill att du ska göra det med oss
* Stöd och mentorskap från våra erfarna experter – vi hjälper dig att växa
* Utbildningar löser vi när det behövs!


**Ansök nu och bygg med oss!**
 Hos oss får du förutsättningar att forma och utveckla din roll och växa i takt med att bolaget expanderar. Som en del av koncernen Qflow Group finns även möjlighet att delta i gruppens delägarskapsprogram samt goda förutsättningar till kompetensutveckling.

title: Engineer Workplace Virtual Desktops
description:
Här arbetar du närmast användarna och applikationslagret och blir länken mellan klient, Citrix och arbetsplatstjänster. Du hanterar både teknisk drift och kravställning för att säkerställa att lösningen håller hög kvalitet och följer verksamhetens behov.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden:**
* Förvalta och utveckla arbetsplatstjänster och virtual desktop-lösningar.
* Säkerställa att tjänster levereras enligt krav – både vid extern och intern drift.
* Delta i strategisk planering, kravhantering, ändringsarbete och uppföljning.
* Ansvara för incidenter, defekter och att lösningar följer arkitektur- och säkerhetsriktlinjer.
* Dokumentation och kvalitetssäkring av tjänster.
* Driva förbättringsarbete enligt roadmap och evergreen-processer.


**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Förvaltning och konfiguration av M365-tjänster (Teams, Exchange Online, SharePoint, OneDrive, tenant-administration).
* Monitorering, licenshantering och behörighetsadministration.
* Change-, problem- och incidenthantering (2nd line).
* Eskaleringar och samordning med interna och externa parter.
* Löpande förbättringsarbete och stöd till produktägare.


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Djup kunskap inom administration, utveckling och drift av M365-tjänster.
* Certifiering som Microsoft 365 Administrator eller motsvarande – meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av Teams-administration (certifiering meriterande).
* God förståelse för arbetsplatstjänster: klienter, telefoni/mobilt, remote access, VDI.
* Kunskaper inom MDM, Azure AD/M365-arkitektur, VPN, Atlassian – meriterande.
* Förståelse för säkerhet kopplat till arbetsplatsmiljöer.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet.


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Strukturerad, analytisk och problemlösande.
* Kommunikativ och skicklig på att samarbeta med både användare och tekniska team.
* Drivs av förbättring, kvalitet och säkerhet.


**Varför detta uppdrag?**
* Du får nyckelroller där du kan påverka teknikval, arkitektur och arbetssätt.
* Du arbetar i en miljö med höga krav på stabilitet, säkerhet och kvalitet.
* Du kommer in i en moderniseringsresa där dina idéer spelar stor roll.
* Du får möjlighet att arbeta både brett och djupt inom VDI, arbetsplatstjänster och infrastruktur.


**Om CONSULTING it:**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Investment Associate
description:
**About Antler**
 Antler backs the world’s most ambitious founders from the very start. Founded on the belief that innovation is the key to building a better future, we partner with people across six continents to launch and scale high-potential startups that address meaningful opportunities and challenges. Knowing that exceptional founders can come from anywhere with any background, we have offices in more than 25 cities, including New York, London, Berlin, Stockholm, Bangalore, Singapore, Seoul, and Sydney.
   

  

 Our global community supports founders on deep business model validation, initial capital, expansion support, and follow-on funding. Fueled by a personal passion that goes beyond traditional investing, we have helped create and invested in more than 1,800 startups across a wide range of industries and technologies.
   

  

 A better future won’t happen automatically - the world needs talented, determined, and resilient people to build it. Antler team members are part of an ambitious global community dedicated to helping the most driven founders move the world forward.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for a driven team member to join Antler’s investment team in Stockholm. In this role, you will help identify, evaluate, and support exceptional founders across the Nordics from day zero. You will work across sourcing, assessment, and portfolio support, giving you a front-row seat to the region’s most ambitious early-stage companies.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Founder Sourcing: Identify, engage, and build strong relationships with exceptional founders and operators across the Nordics
* Investment Process: Support screening, analysis, and decision-making for early-stage investments
* Portfolio Support: Work closely with founders pre- and post-investment on topics such as GTM strategy, fundraising, product, and growth
* Ecosystem Building: Expand Antler’s network across the Nordic tech ecosystem, including investors, angels, universities, operators, and other key stakeholders
* Market & Product Insight: Contribute to internal views on industries, technologies, and founder archetypes that drive high-potential company creation


**Requirements**
* 1–2 years of experience in startups, venture capital, consulting, product, or a similar high-performance environment
* Experience as a founder or early-stage operator at a fast-growing scale-up is a strong plus
* Strong understanding of product, growth, and early-stage company-building fundamentals
* Excellent communication and relationship-building skills
* Highly organised, proactive, and driven by curiosity and ambition
* Based in Stockholm with a deep passion for working with early-stage founders


**What Antler Offers**
* Direct exposure to the Nordic region’s most ambitious founders at the earliest stages of company building
* The opportunity to develop deep expertise in early-stage investing across a wide range of industries and business models
* A highly dynamic and entrepreneurial environment surrounded by exceptional founders and a global Antler community
* A central Stockholm office where founders build their companies at high velocity—creating a uniquely energetic and inspiring atmosphere


 Powered by JazzHR
   

  

 rSDgJ7DZ6O

title: IT-Support | Förstalinje: Details
description:
**Job Description**
 Att arbeta på Coherent innebär att vara en del av ett globalt teknikbolag i framkant. Coherent är en av världens ledande aktörer inom fotonik, laserteknik och avancerade material, med omkring 35 000 medarbetare i över 20 länder. Våra lösningar används i allt från industriell tillverkning och halvledare till medicinteknik, forskning och kommunikation. Som medarbetare på Coherent får du möjlighet att utvecklas både professionellt och personligt i en organisation som kombinerar starkt lokalt engagemang med internationellt samarbete.
   

  

 Som IT Support på Coherent får du en vardag som är både tydlig och varierad. Du arbetar på plats i våra lokaler i Järfälla, där du stöttar kollegor i både renrums- och kontorsmiljön. Rollen handlar mycket om att ge praktisk hjälp: se till att datorer och tillbehör fungerar, installera och felsöka utrustning, hantera beställningar och konfigurering, och hjälpa användare som behöver stöd i sina system och verktyg.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvar**
* Arbeta på plats med förstalinjessupport i vår renrumsproduktion och på våra kontorsplatser.
* Hantera klienthårdvarans livscykel: beställning, mottagning, inventering och konfiguration av stationära datorer, bärbara datorer och tillbehör.
* Koordinera reparation och återställning av klienthårdvara med varierande ålder och operativsystem.
* Patcha nätverksuttag, vitlista och domänansluta produktionssystem och tillbehör.
* Hantera och tillhandahålla mobiltelefoner och abonnemang samt supportera lokala mobila tjänster och lösningar.
* Hantera skrivare och konferensrumsutrustning.
* Onboarding, offboarding och användaradministration.
* Samarbeta med kollegor både lokalt och internationellt, inklusive team i Europa, Indien och USA.
* Bidra till lokala och globala IT-projekt med fokus på hög servicekvalitet och kundnöjdhet.


**Kvalifikationer och erfarenhet**
* Erfarenhet av liknande teknisk roll, gärna inom industri, elektronik, optoelektronik eller tillverkningsmiljö.
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, självständigt och med flera parallella uppgifter.
* Teknisk kompetens inom installation, felsökning och återställning av användarhårdvara eller testsystem.
* God samarbetsförmåga i tvärfunktionella team.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Microsofts miljöer (O365, SCCM, AD m.fl.).
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* God förmåga att prioritera och fatta genomtänkta beslut när IT-problem påverkar produktionen.


**Vår kultur**
 På Coherent arbetar vi enligt våra värderingar ICARE —
 **Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Respect och Enthusiasm** 
 — vilket präglar hur vi samarbetar, löser problem och stödjer verksamheten i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En tekniskt stimulerande miljö där du får utvecklas och bredda dina kunskaper inom IT.
* En stöttande, professionell och internationell arbetskultur.
* Ett innovationsdrivet företag i framkant.
* Subventionerad massage på kontoret och möjlighet till kvartalsvis eller årlig bonus.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och hälsofrämjande aktiviteter.


 Om du är en motiverad IT-specialist som trivs i en samarbetsinriktad, innovativ och dynamisk miljö, uppmuntrar vi dig att ansöka och bli en del av vårt team i Järfälla.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar löpande urval. Som en del av processen genomförs referenstagning samt alkohol- och drogtest innan anställning.
   

  

**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.

title: Tech Manager
description:
**If you’re looking to make the best co-op games in the world, you’ve come to the right place. We're proud to have some of the best game makers and collaborators in the industry working with us. What's more, we're a fun bunch of game developers, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together. Our games are not for everyone. Are they for you?**
 We are now looking for a Tech Manager
   

  

 We are now looking for a Tech Manager, a people-focused leader who ensures everything runs smoothly within their tech disciplines.
   

  

 You’ll manage and support developers from various disciplines and experience levels, helping them grow their skills while aligning their work with Arrowhead’s vision and goals.
   

  

 You’ll understand both the needs of our players and the project’s broader requirements, using that knowledge to guide professional development and foster a culture of high standards and continuous improvement.
   

  

 A Tech Manager at Arrowhead knows what great looks like and builds the environment, tools, and practices needed to reach it. You set a high bar, but you also make sure the team has the resources, clarity, and support to meet it. You’re steady under pressure, and can navigate both creative and technical challenges with empathy and confidence.
   

  

 You’ll lead through influence rather than direct production work, coaching, mentoring, and enabling others to excel in their crafts while ensuring the studio uses its talent to the fullest.
   

  

**Who you are:**
 We believe that you
   

  

* Bring previous experience as a Lead or Manager within tech disciplines in the game industry
* Are passionate about leading people, building strong teams, and cultivating healthy, collaborative environments
* Understand the balance between creative freedom and production discipline
* Have the confidence to handle challenges constructively and keep your team motivated through change
* Can identify what excellence looks like in tech area and help others get there
* Communicate clearly and thoughtfully in English, both written and spoken
* Have proven leadership experience with a track record of guiding successful technical teams in the game industry


**What You'll Do**
* Recruit and onboard new team members
* Set clear expectations, provide constructive feedback, and follow up on goals and development plans
* Conduct performance reviews, development talks, promotions, and salary discussions
* Support your team’s growth by creating opportunities for learning and collaboration
* Build and maintain a safe, inclusive, and inspiring work environment
* Ensure Arrowhead’s talents and skills are used effectively across projects
* Collaborate with different stakeholders such as directors, production, CTO and senior leadership to align and execute


****How to apply****
 If you think that this position matches your background and skills, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your CV in English as soon as possible. We ask that your application always include relevant work samples or a link to your portfolio.
   

  

 We interview candidates continuously and hire when we find a good fit.
   

  

**Practical Information**
**Scope:** 
 Full-time: 40 hours per week with initial 6 month probation period.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Office first, hybrid solution possible.
   

  

**We are a pet friendly office! You can expect to find dogs and occasionally some cats around.**
**What We Offer**
 Arrowhead Game Studios is a growing team of about 100+ people, best known for our co-op titles. Despite our size, we remain a friendly and down to earth bunch, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together.
   

  

 Located in a newly built, custom-tailored offices on the Hammarby Kaj waterfront, we enjoy everything Stockholm has to offer. A thriving game dev scene, along with all types of activities are immediately available on our doorstep.
   

  

 Our talented developers are crucial to our success, therefore we put a lot of emphasis in creating and maintaining a prosperous culture. We’re committed to open and transparent communication. Your ideas are welcomed, valued, appreciated - the ceiling for creative discussions is high.
   

  

 We also have numerous work benefits for all our employees. You can read about them here!

title: Product Analyst
description:
**About Anyfin**
 At Anyfin, we believe in simplicity, transparency, and fairness. We’re the fintech on a mission to challenge the status quo, lowering interest rates, removing unnecessary fees, and helping people take control of their finances. To do that, we rely on data. Data that doesn’t just exist; data that’s designed, understood, and turned into action.
   

  

 With more than a million app downloads and presence in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Germany, we’ve already helped hundreds of thousands of people save money and feel more financially empowered.
   

  

 We recently obtained our banking license, opening up an entirely new world of opportunities to provide more value to our customers, build even smarter products, scale our technology, and expand into new markets. This next chapter comes with exciting challenges, and we’re looking for a Product Analyst who’s eager to take them on.
   

  

**The role**
 As a Product Analyst you will architect measurement frameworks, drive clarity in our data strategy, and own our product metrics from the ground up. You’ll get to build from scratch. You will have the rare chance to architect our product analytics foundation and shape how we measure and follow up on success.
   

  

 Today we have a data-driven culture, great SQL expertise, and a whole bunch of dashboards. What we lack is clear ownership of our data abstractions, product metrics, A/B tests and experiments. That’s where you come in: to define, build, and drive.
   

  

**You Will**
* Define our measurement framework Partner with Data Engineering to design and build the infrastructure we need: define the metrics that matter, identify gaps in our data abstractions, and ensure a clean, scalable product analytics foundation.
* Upgrade our experimentation Take a critical look at our AB testing infrastructure. Propose, build, and implement a more robust system for experiments, so we can learn faster and make better product decisions.
* Work hands-on with analysis and systems Dive into data, both by doing analyses and by building the systems that power it. You’ll help set up dataflows, aggregations, and processes.
* Manage stakeholders across teams Collaborate with product managers, data engineers, engineers, and more.
* Own important metrics You’ll help define what “success” means for Anyfin’s product features. You’ll track and report on those metrics, follow up on product performance, and iterate on how to improve.


**What You’ll Bring**
* Proven experience from data-driven organizations. You’ve seen how analytics can be done well, ideally in places that scale or iterate quickly.
* Strong SQL and BI skills (in any BI tool).
* Experience from digital products, bonus if it’s from the financial sector.
* Ownership mindset. This is a greenfield role. You won’t be handed a detailed playbook - you will define what needs doing, build it, and own the outcome. You’re not just executing; you’re building.
* Product and business fluency. You understand how business goals translate into product metrics, and how product decisions affect business outcomes.
* It’s a plus if you’re familiar with Python.


**Why Anyfin?**
 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located office in Stockholm, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to own the product analytics of a growing fintech, build things from zero, and drive real product impact?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

*Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.*
 We can’t wait to see what you will be creating!
   

  

 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Software Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
 We believe that you are fully fluid in both backend and frontend development with primarily focus on .Net/C# (Java is a bonus) and enjoy solving complex technical problems. You know how to build scalable and well performing solutions. You have experience working with databases such as Mongo, Cosmos and UX/UI and with CI/CD pipelines. You also know your way around Kubernetes, Typescript, Azure Cloud Services, React and Angular. You understand what it means to work with agile team principles.
   

  

 It is also beneficial if you have some experience with direct client management, network programming such as TCP/UDP and vehicle protocols CAN, CAN-FD, DoIP, UDS, Windows desktop application development in WinUI/WPF.
   

  

 Like taking requirements and have a solid passion for the user needs and user journey.
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 12-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Copilot Solution Engineer - AI Business Solutions
description:
**Overview**
 Join a team of highly engaged Solution Engineer to help our most valuable customers and our Sales Specialist to navigate the AI Workforce transformation in a productive and secure way. Our ambition is to truly partner with our customers for long-term success, always finding new ways for them to achieve more through the possibilities of technology.
   

  

 Our purpose is to empower organizations to transform the way they work by harnessing the full potential of artificial intelligence. We guide customers through the evolving digital landscape, enabling them to unlock new opportunities, enhance productivity, and deliver exceptional employee and customer experiences.
   

  

 As a
 **Solution Engineer in the AI Business Solutions – Copilot team,** 
 you will lead technical engagements that drive AI transformation for enterprise customers. Your mission is to win technical decisions and accelerate adoption of Microsoft 365 Copilot, Copilot Chat, Copilot Studio & Agents, and related solutions by delivering compelling demos, envisioning sessions, and scalable architectures.
   

  

 This role is pivotal in shaping the future of work by enabling customers to realize the full potential of AI-powered productivity. You will collaborate closely with sales, customer success, engineering, and partner teams to remove technical blockers, generate pipeline, and ensure seamless handoffs for deployment and adoption.
   

  

 Your passion for learning, high emotional intelligence, executive presence, presentation and technical skills will help you succeed in this role.
   

  

 Ready to make an impact. Apply now and help our customer pivot in the AI Era.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees, we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with account team and act as a advisor for Copilot and Agent towards customers.
* Understand and discuss value related to customer business and processes.
* Assist in gathering customer requirements and documenting technical needs.
* Participate in technical close plan creation and maintain CRM hygiene under guidance.
* Build skills in envisioning, architecture, and compliance.
* Complete foundational certifications within technical offerings and consultative selling.
* Contribute to team learning by sharing observations and asking questions during debriefs.


**Qualifications**
 Required Qualifications
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field AND a few years of experience in technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or customer-facing roles OR Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field AND a couple of years of experience in technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or customer-facing roles OR equivalent experience
* A few years of hands-on experience with Microsoft 365, Teams, Power Platform, and AI productivity tools (or equivalent)


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong communication and collaboration skills; eager to learn from team members
* Working toward certifications such as L200 Consultative Selling
* Fluency in Swedish and English
* Demonstrated curiosity and a growth mindset, with a willingness to take on stretch assignments


 This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about
 **requesting accommodations.**

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision - to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions. ⚡
   

  

 We’re now expanding our website team with an
 **Fullstack Engineer** 
 . Are you ready to join the Power Shift?
   

  

**About The Role & The Team**
 As our
 **Fullstack Engineer (with a frontend focus)** 
 in the Website team, you’ll be part of a talented and ambitious agile team. Together you’ll design and implement technical solutions for Svea Solar’s website and related areas, ensuring a seamless experience between our site and our smart energy platform
 *Sunbeam* 
 .
   

  

 You’ll work closely with another Teach lead, a frontend engineer, an analyst, and a product manager, reporting to our Engineering Manager Anna. We follow a collaboration-first approach, working three days a week from our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Build and maintain both frontend and backend features, with a strong focus on frontend.
* Develop modern, accessible, and semantically correct websites using HTML5 and CSS3 (SASS).
* Write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code in TypeScript/JavaScript and React.js.
* Design and implement REST APIs and integrations with our CMS written in Python.
* Collaborate with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers to create functional and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural discussions and best practices, supporting long-term scalability and event-driven design.


 Are we a match?
   

  

**We’re Looking For You Who…**
* Value team success over personal success and thrive in a collaborative dynamic environment.
* Have at least 5 years of professional experience in software development, including at least 2 years in backend.
* Have strong experience with: TypeScript, React, Node.js, Express, REST APIs, CMS, and event-driven design.
* Have solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and SASS.
* Are fluent in English and Swedish.


**Bonus points if you..**
* Have experience with Next.js, i18next, Motion/React Spring, Tailwind, Styled-components.
* Are comfortable with Python, Django, Wagtail, or Deno.


 🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you
   

  

**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
   

  

**About**
**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
   

  

**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
   

  

**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
   

  

**Flexibility/ hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
   

  

 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
   

  

 ⚡Who are we
   

  

 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
   

  

  

  

**About Our Recruitment Process**
* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.


 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: Backend Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Back-end Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has experience working with back-end micro-services on Kubernetes and loves to develop alongside a team of talented engineers.
   

  

 If you are a back-end engineer or a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create the container infrastructure platform for the company
* Coordinate with other infrastructure teams to meet goals
* Enhance delivery systems with Continuous Integration
* Improve the monitoring and alert system
* Troubleshoot issues and solve problems where needed

* At least 3+ years of experience working with Kubernetes
* Strong expertise in CI/CD implementation
* Thorough knowledge of Java, Spring Boot & Azure

**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
